body.p: If an entity measures non‑controlling interests as its proportionate interest in the net identifiable assets of a subsidiary at the acquisition date, rather than at fair value, goodwill attributable to non‑controlling interests is included in the recoverable amount of the related cash‑generating unit but is not recognised in the parent’s consolidated financial statements. As a consequence, an entity shall gross up the carrying amount of goodwill allocated to the unit to include the goodwill attributable to the non‑controlling interest. This adjusted carrying amount is then compared with the recoverable amount of the unit to determine whether the cash‑generating unit is impaired.
